body_html:
These are the commands I used to install tensorflow with python 2:

sudo apt-get install python-virtualenv
virtualenv --system-site-packages /media/hadi/tmpstore/tensorflow_vp2/
source /media/hadi/tmpstore/tensorflow_vp2/bin/activate
pip install --upgrade tensorflow-gpu
deactivate
source /media/hadi/tmpstore/tensorflow_vp2/bin/activate
pip install ipython

Now I am trying to perform faster-RCNN for object detection based on github pages. But every time there is this error with python 2:

import tensorflow as tf

ImportError: No module named tensorflow

In the pip list there is line like this:

tensorflow-gpu (1.0.1)

deactivate

pip install ipython
Now I am trying to perform faster-RCNN for object detection based on github pages. But every time there is this error with python 2:

import tensorflow as tf


ImportError: No module named tensorflow

In the pip list there is line like this:

tensorflow-gpu (1.0.1)
body:
These are the commands I used to install tensorflow with python 2:

` sudo apt-get install python-virtualenv`
` virtualenv --system-site-packages /media/hadi/tmpstore/tensorflow_vp2/`
`source /media/hadi/tmpstore/tensorflow_vp2/bin/activate`
`pip install --upgrade tensorflow-gpu`
`deactivate`
`source /media/hadi/tmpstore/tensorflow_vp2/bin/activate`
`pip install ipython`

Now I am trying to perform faster-RCNN for object detection based on github pages. But every time there is this error with python 2:

> import tensorflow as tf

> ImportError: No module named tensorflow

In the `pip list` there is line like this:

> tensorflow-gpu (1.0.1)
